frame.name: Cause_to_move_in_place
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes a <fen>Theme</fen> to move with respect to a certain <fen>Fixed_location</fen>, generally with a certain <fen>Periodicity</fen>, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape. <ex><fex name="Agent">Paul</fex> <t>shook</t> <fex name="Theme">the remote control</fex> <fex name="Manner">frantically</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Theme</fen> identifies the object involved in motion.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Explanation</fen> for which an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is the way in which the motion in place is instigated.</def-root>

FE.name: Periodicity
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of times the Theme returns to a state in a given duration. <ex>It <t>turns</t> <fex name="Per">at 1000 rpms</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Fixed_location
FE.definition: <def-root>The point or set of points that define the limits of motion for the Theme. For spinning motions, it is the axis, for vibrating it is a boundary, for swinging it is a point. <ex>She <t>twirled</t> <fex name="Fix_loc">around him</fex> several times.</ex> <ex>Balls <t>spin</t> <fex name="Fix_loc">on their axes </fex>.</ex> <ex>The window <t>vibrated</t> <fex name="Fix_loc">in the frame</fex>.</ex> <ex>He <t>swung</t> <fex name="Fix_loc">by a single handhold</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an intentional act is performed. </def-root>

FE.name: Angle
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Angle</fen> identifies the amount that the <fen>Theme</fen> turns. <ex><t>Spin</t> the dial <fex name="Ang">a quarter turn</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Locus
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen>'s manipulation of an <fen>Theme</fen> may be further specified as being localized to some part of the <fen>Theme</fen>, a <fen>Locus</fen>. This FE is usually expressed as a PP Complement. <ex>Pat <t>squeezed</t> Jo <fex name="Locus">by the hand</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Bodypart_of_agent
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the part of the Agent's body being used to manipulate the <fen>Theme</fen>. <ex>Kim <t>twirled</t> the glass <fex name="Bodypart_of_agent">in his fingers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the motion in place. <ex><fex name="Cause">The wind</fex> <t>vibrated</t> the string.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is used for all path-like expressions, that express the <fen>Direction</fen> of the swinging, vibrating or rotating.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of an event.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: twirl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: spin something quickly and lightly round.

lexUnit.name: spin.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to turn round quickly

lexUnit.name: vibrate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to move with small movements rapidly to and fro.

lexUnit.name: shake.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to tremble or vibrate or move something forcefully up and down or back and forth.

lexUnit.name: swing.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move or cause to move back and forth or from side to side while or as if suspended

lexUnit.name: seesaw.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: change rapidly and repeatedly from one state or position to another and back again.

lexUnit.name: turn.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move or cause to move in a circular direction wholly or partly around an axis.

lexUnit.name: rotate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to move in a circle round an axis.

lexUnit.name: squeeze.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: firmly press from opposite or all sides, typically with the fingers.

lexUnit.name: swirl.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to move in a circular or spiral form

lexUnit.name: rock.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move something from side to side

lexUnit.name: roll.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move something by turning over and over

lexUnit.name: wave.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move something back and forth with a swaying motion while remaining fixed to one point

lexUnit.name: juggle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: throw and catch repeatedly in a manner very demanding of dexterity, putting several objects in the air at once.

lexUnit.name: jiggle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to move slightly and relatively rapidly back and forth.

lexUnit.name: wiggle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to move slightly back and forth.
